title: Consumer preference : fiction versus non-fiction books in England 2013
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Mixture of both and lowest at Response Neither.
The highest Response Mixture of both has 36.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Neither.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Response Mixture of both has the highest Share of respondents and Neither has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Mixture of both and lowest at Response Neither.
The highest Response Mixture of both has 36.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Neither.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Response Mixture of both has the highest Share of respondents and Neither has the lowest Share of respondents.
Second maximum Share of respondents is found at Response Fiction.
The Share of respondents of Response Mixture of both is 5.5% larger than the minimum value at Neither.
Share of respondents at Response Mixture of both is 44.0 , second place is Fiction at 26.0, and thirdly is Non-fiction at 22.0.
The Response Neither has 1.76 times less Share of respondents than average.
The Share of respondents is 100.0 if we add up values of all Responses.
